│   │   Images:
│   │     - [Image #0] The image shows a text passage that discusses the importance of synthesizing two opposing thought pathways. The passage is divided into three paragraphs.
│   │       
│   │       The passage begins by stating that there are two contradictory thought pathways that must be synthesized into one's brain. The first pathway acknowledges that the reader's position is understandable and that there is no shame in it. The second pathway emphasizes that everyone is facing hard times and that the reader is out of excuses and running out of patience.
│   │       
│   │       To reproduce this image, one would need to recreate the text passage with the same content and formatting. The text should be presented in a clear and readable font, with the same paragraph structure and sentence layout as the original image.
│   │       
│   │       The text in the image reads: 
│   │       
│   │       "Oh I have two beginnings for you, two opposing-but-necessary thought-pathways that you have to synthesize into your brain. They are contradictory. You will not like them. But you must read them. They are:
│   │       
│   │       1. These are hard times, and it is okay to be where you are. Your position is perfectly understandable, and there is absolutely no shame in it. You can work on this, and you can bring yourself into the life that you would like to have. Everyone takes a different path, and no one path is better than any other - some people simply come into themselves later in life.
│   │       
│   │       2. These are always hard times and everyone is in a recession. You are out of excuses and we are running out of patience. Others spent their twenties improving themselves, taking joy in their skills, building their futures and forming their hearts in the very same difficult economic climate; you spent your twenties so terrified of risk and rejection that you bummed yourself right out of the game, and it's nobody else's responsibility to haul you back into it. You are not inherently entitled to a regular wage, a pleasant job, a comfortable home or a willing girlfriend, and complaining that life has not yet handed you these things because "you still need to work on your confidence" is naive at best and offensive at worst.
│   │       
│   │       Absorb and reconcile these two pathways in your head. Both are true. You are in an understandable place; but you have been selfish with your energy and lazy with your opportunities. You are going through some very real, very difficult stuff; yet you have not given very much to the world. You have to pay something into the Universe's collection plate before you can reasonably expect to get anything back. Give some piece of your body, soul, time, energy, labor, strength, intelligence,

Tempted to do a a earnestly-silly port of F.A.N. into a pastafarianism-type silly-jokey religion by working thru 0 HP's Major Ingredients. Please do not read this thread if you are overly susceptible to idolatry and/or True Belief. Ask your doctor if True Belief is right for you

↓
1271077775592456192 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 7
5. Dietary Taboos. I don't personally care too much about what I eat. FANs probably kinda lean health-conscious-ish: less sugar, maybe vegetarian or vegan-ish, some keto folks, etc etc, some diversity, common sense thoughtfulness, No Need To Make a Huge Thing About It
↓
1271078316502466562 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 9
now when we talk about INFORMATION diets, we get much stronger opinions and POVs. FANs are infovores; hungry hungry hippos for learning and knowledge. You might even think of them as competitive eaters but for insight, perspective, worldviews and so on
↓
1271078821286961152 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 8
one of the core info diet rules of FANs is "do not quote tweet cringe. if your friend quote tweets cringe, inform her privately so that she might realize her mistake and take it down"

 https://t.co/xhWl1NpoFE
  [Quoting @visakanv: quote-tweeting cringe should be a graver faux pas than posting cringe in the first place]
↓
1271079243120668672 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 8
why? because FANs depend on the sanctity of the public commons in order to do their work. they respect and revere the commons, and so they do not pollute the commons with cringe that gets amplified into runaway cascading effects. save that shit for your private alt
↓
1271080690235305986 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 8 🔁 1 💬 1
Every FAN does a little public service + cleanup duty in the commons around their spheres. Some of them started out as angry Facebook Warriors, but have since learned that it's more productive and less stressful to play the long game – be cheerfully curious, collect allies
↓
1271082057117007873 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 5
6. Evangelism, ie Spreading The Word. FANdom is fairly easy-ish to spread. It can be copied. One person's thread can inspire hundreds others to make threads, too. You don't need to be a perfect FAN yourself to help make the world more FAN-friendly. Support your local FAN today!
↓
1271082423321673729 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 12
an important core principle of FAN evangelism is that you can never persuade someone else to care by yelling at them that they should care more. YOU have to care. YOU have to be interested. so don't worry about evangelising. Just obsess about what you love https://t.co/BrcjWpZaie
  [Quoting @visakanv: You can’t get people to read books by telling them that literature is important. You get them to read books by being excited about books. And “books are so exciting!!!” doesn’t cut it, you have to get into precisely what you’re excited about. This is how interest spreads]
↓
1271083015863537665 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 11
in any given population, there are always some closeted FANs. they've simply never known other FANs IRL, and so live in fear of expressing themselves, their feelings, their ambitions, their passions. part of the joy of being a FAN is helping young FANs along. (no pressure tho!!)
↓
1271084491482619905 [2020-06-11] @visakanv 💜 12

- cheeky
- curious
- playful
- mischievous
- constructive

- supportive
- rebuilding the Library of Alexandria / Baghdad House of Wisdom

    "Solemnity, I don't know what it's for. I mean, what is the point of it? The two most beautiful memorial services that I've ever attended both had a lot of humor. It somehow freed us all and made the services inspiring and cathartic. But solemnity, it serves pomposity. The self-important always know at some level of their consciousness that their egotism is going to be punctured by humor. That's why they see it as a threat. And so, dishonestly, they pretend that their deficiency makes their views more substantial."

    "There are basically two kinds of philosophy. One's called prickles, the other's called goo. And prickly people are precise, rigorous, logical. They like everything chopped up and clear. Goo people like it vague. For example, in physics, prickly people believe that the ultimate constituents of matter are particles. Goo people believe it's waves. And in philosophy, prickly people are logical positivists, and goo people are idealists. And they're always arguing with each other, but what they don't realize is neither one can take his position without the other person. Because you wouldn't know you advocated prickles unless there was someone advocating goo. You wouldn't know what a prickle was unless you knew what a goo was. Because life isn't either prickles or goo, it's either gooey prickles or prickly goo."
